source.text: Any critical failure during the Active Mode will force the OBU to enter the Failed Mode ( see transition_A-F in PTC.SDD .6534 ) .

target.text: The Trainguard PTC System shall have a Failed Mode where the Locomotive segment_transitions if a vital hardware or software failure has been detected [ REQ1433 Base_Source : PTCDP ] .

contexts.PTC: PTC can automatically reduce a trainâs speed or even stop it to avoid a collision or derailment.

source.text: As illustrated in PTC.SDD_.6501_status of field elements is consumed by the WIU which in turn creates a wayside_status_message and broadcasts that message out to any train within range .

target.text: The Wayside_Segment shall transmit information to the Locomotive_Segment in the form of wayside_status_messages ( WSMs ) [ REQ0392 Base_Source : / Caltrain_RFP / ] .

contexts.wayside_status_messages: Wayside Status Messages (WSM) handle time critical communications from wayside to trains, relaxing the communication demands between the office and the field as compared to the existing centralized interlocking architectures.

source.text: The implementation of the abstraction layer will provide the overall flexibility needed by the TG - PTC to provide a common set of internal calls to the interface while allowing for specific interface changes when integrating with a railroad_-_specific_Dispatch_System .

target.text: 5.3.1 Office_Segment PTC.SRS .48 shows the Office Office_Segment boundaries . The components contained in the thatched rectangle in PTC.SRS .48 are part of or are users of the Office Segment Office_Segment BOS and its maintenance_workstations and interfaces ) . The Operations_Control_System ( OCS ) and Wayside_Locomotive and Communication Segments are not considered part of the BOS system environment though BOS may interface with them directly or indirectly . In addition to the above the Employee in Charge ( EIC ) terminal is equipment which is used in the field by maintenance crews . The EIC_terminal will be allocated to one of the four PTC segments when its requirements specification is available .

contexts.PTC: PTC can automatically reduce a trainâs speed or even stop it to avoid a collision or derailment.

source.text: The goal of ITC Systems Management ( ITCSM ) is to keep all ITC systems operational . ITCSM will do the following for ITC assets ( i.e. OBUs_wayside_interface_units_base_stations ) : Establish a security infrastructure for distributing sensitive dataEnable_interoperabilityEnforce_access_controlsEnable over the air_updates ( e.g. configuration software ) Support_problem_diagnosis through the generation and distribution of notifications and logs.The overall ITCSM architecture is depicted in PTC.SDD .7412 .

ITCSM will consist of an ITCSM Gateway hosted by each railroad back office . Each ITC Asset ( e.g. WIU OBU 220 Radio messaging system components ) will be assigned to exactly one Gateway and will have an ITCSM Agent that manages it . An ITCSM Agent may either be embedded with an ITC Asset ( ITCSM Embedded Agent ) or run on a single board computer that is connected to the ITC Asset ( ITCSM Remote Agent ) via LAN . For the TG - PTC whether an asset will use an embedded or Remote agent_configuration will be decided during design of the particular asset .

definitions.Remote: Used to refer to an area or asset which is not an office (that is, locomotive or wayside). Also used to refer to a radio on the other side of an RF connection from the radio under discussion.

contexts.OBU: The OBU provides a safety overlay for railroad operations through brake enforcement.

source.text: The functionality provided will be similar to that of system_software_updates that occur when a laptop is powered up and connected to a network .

target.text: 6.3.1 Initializing_Mode ( REQ0758 ) The Trainguard PTC System shall enter Initializing Initializing_Mode the start of a new mission and occupies this mode until Track_Database update crew identification operational data initialization and departure_test_procedures have completed successfully [ REQ0758 Base_Source : / PTCDP / ] .

definitions.Track_Database: A database onboard a locomotive with information about the track and waysides along a route. This information is used by the ETMS/TMC to implement PTC functionality.

target.text: 6.2.18 Predictive_Enforcement ( REQ1112 ) The Trainguard PTC System shall predictively enforce track_bulletins forms based authorities track devices speed limits derails or switches and consist or lading_speed_restrictions which includes train based permanent speed restrictions [ REQ1112 Base_Sources : / CONOPS / Section 5.11.2 / AAR S - 9052B / ] .

contexts.AAR: AAR welcomes renewed call for Positive Train Control implementation extension

source.text: The TG - PTC will interface to a railroad_-_specific_Dispatch_System to receive the current set of Mandatory Directives_Track_Bulletins_Movement_Authorities ( Train Mission ) and the other enforceable operational conditions . These Dispatch_Systems are specific to the various railroads and as such require the TG - PTC to be flexible enough to interface with all of them . The TG - PTC will provide an abstraction layer between it and the Dispatch Dispatch_Systems all specific Dispatch_System_interface_requirements are contained within the abstraction layer . The TG - PTC will utilize the internal side of the abstraction layer which will only change if the TG - PTC requires it to . All specific implementation changes will be limited to the Dispatch_System_side of the abstraction layer .

contexts.PTC: PTC can automatically reduce a trainâs speed or even stop it to avoid a collision or derailment.

source.text: There are several communication channels for ITCSM . Each owning railroad back office hosts an ITCSM Gateway with which it will communicate . The interface between Gateway and back office will be railroad specific . ITCSM Gateways from different railroads will communicate with each other to support interoperability between railroads . This communication is done through the Interoperable Systems Management Protocol ( ISMP ) which is an application_-_level_protocol built on top of EMP and thus supports existing ITCM_communications_infrastructure .

definitions.Interoperable: Communications directly between the remote asset of one railroad and the office of another railroad.

source.text: The TG - PTC will interface to a railroad_-_specific_Dispatch_System to receive the current set of Mandatory Directives_Track_Bulletins_Movement_Authorities ( Train Mission ) and the other enforceable operational conditions . These Dispatch_Systems are specific to the various railroads and as such require the TG - PTC to be flexible enough to interface with all of them . The TG - PTC will provide an abstraction layer between it and the Dispatch Dispatch_Systems all specific Dispatch_System_interface_requirements are contained within the abstraction layer . The TG - PTC will utilize the internal side of the abstraction layer which will only change if the TG - PTC requires it to . All specific implementation changes will be limited to the Dispatch_System_side of the abstraction layer .

target.text: 5.4.3 Human Factors_Engineering ( REQ1094 ) The Trainguard PTC System shall sufficiently incorporate human factors Factors_Engineering is appropriate to the intended operators and complexity of the system [ REQ1094 Base_Source : / PTC Final Rule / 49 CFR_236_Subpart I Appendix E / AAR S - 9052A / ] . Guidance : The Siemens Trainguard HMI design shall be accompanied by a human factors engineering Factors_Engineering for train operators and user_maintenance_personnel .

source.text: Whenever time_drift occurs the receiver shall always compare the message_timestamp with their internal clock for validity_purposes .

target.text: 5.11.12 Wayside_Time_Synchronization ( REQ1433 ) The Wayside_Segment WIU shall maintain its clock synchronization with an external time source as per design needs of the owning and operating railroads [ REQ1433 Base_Source : / S_-_9052D / ] .

source.text: For interoperability purposes this interface is prescribed by the AAR ITC Committee . The interface is defined within the IDD OBU WIU / PTC - D - 0003 / . The ICD describes the message formats . The communications network connecting these subsystems uses the standard protocols described in EMP Specification / S - 9354 / ; Class_C Messaging Specification / S - 9355 / ; and Class_D Messaging Specification / S - 9356 / .

definitions.Class_C: An AAR published protocol which is substantially based upon UDP/IP.

definitions.Class_D: A protocol that converts a stream based TCP protocol to a message or transaction based protocol. Class D also adds support for features such as connection monitoring/persistence and high availability. See section6.3.1.
